title: Narodil se Kristus Pán
text:
"Narodil se Kristus Pán" (The Lord Christ Was Born), in English version "Be joyful, Earth and starry sky" is a Czech <a href="Christmas%20carol">Christmas carol</a> and <a href="Christianity">Christian</a> <a href="hymn">hymn</a>. The text and melody come from the oldest preserved record of the song in <a href="Latin">Latin</a> ("En Virgo parit filium") and <a href="Czech%20language">Czech</a> in the Gradual of the Czech Silver Museum in <a href="Kutn%C3%A1%20Hora">Kutná Hora</a>, written in the late 15th century, but the song itself is considered to be older. Some historians date it back to the 13th century, while others believe it is originally a <a href="Hussite">Hussite</a> hymn from the first decades of the 15th century. The song is regarded as the most popular Czech carol and it is sung regularly today at the end of <a href="catholic">catholic</a> <a href="Mass%20in%20the%20Catholic%20Church">Mass</a> and other Christian worship services in the Czech Republic during <a href="Christmas">Christmas</a> time.
The simple and jolly melody has been varied several times, most notably into the <a href="German%20language">German</a> "<a href="Freu%20dich%2C%20Erd%20und%20Sternenzelt">Freu dich, Erd und Sternenzelt</a>." The Old Czech tune did not contain the <a href="tritone">tritone</a> (augmented fourth) in the beginning, which can be heard in today's modern editions without exception. In the oldest document, it is in <a href="triple%20metre">triple metre</a>.
Latin lyrics.
En virgo partit filium
<poem>
En virgo parit filium,
iubilemus,
rosa gignit lilium,
exultemus.
Natum sine patre
filium cum matre
collaudemus.
</poem>
Czech lyrics.
Narodil se Kristus Pán
This version comes from the beginning of 15th century and it is usually sung today with 5th and 6th <a href="strophe">strophe</a>
<poem>
1) Narodil se Kristus Pán, veselme se,
z růže kvítek vykvet' nám, radujme se!
Z života čistého, z rodu královského,
již nám narodil se.
2) Jenž prorokován jest, veselme se,
ten na svět poslán jest, radujme se!
Z života čistého, z rodu královského,
již nám narodil se.
3) Člověčenství naše, veselme se,
ráčil vzíti na se, radujme se!
Z života čistého, z rodu královského,
již nám narodil se.
4) Goliáš oloupen, veselme se,
člověk jest vykoupen, radujme se!
Z života čistého, z rodu královského,
již nám narodil se.
5) Ó milosti Božská, budiž s námi;
dejž, ať zlost ďábelská nás nemámí.
Pro Syna milého, nám narozeného,
smiluj se nad námi!
6) Dejž dobré skončení, ó Ježíši,
věčné utěšení věrných duší!
Přijď nám k spomožení, zbav nás zatracení
pro své narození.
</poem>
<score lang="ABC" midi="1" vorbis="1">
F2 F2 A2 B2 c2 c2 c4 B2 c2 d4 c8
c2 c2 _B2 B2 A2 A2 G4 A2 _B2 A2 G2 F8
A2 G2 A2 _B2 c4 F4 A2 G2 A2 _B2 c4 F4 F4 d4 c2 _B2 A2 G2 F8|]</score>
